DOC.brief_summary: The goal project implement Collaborative Translational Research Center ( TRC ) Network Study aim assure optimal two-way communication ophthalmologists patient ' primary care physician ( PCP ) . The Collaborative TRC Network Study 2 objective : - To design develop common research protocol develop 4-year retrospective database ( 2007-2010 ) compile electronic billing medical chart information use study individual-level , clinical-level system-level factor impact access quality vision care ; - To evaluate adherence dilate fundus exam ( DFEs ) follow-up primary measureable quality indicator , relationship patient ' demographic , ethnicity , socioeconomic status ( SES ) , severity diabetic retinopathy ( DR ) , ocular medical co-morbidities , presence HA1C , primary care provider ( PCP ) communication . By enhance communication strengthen clinical information exchange PCPs eye care professional , Collaborative TRC Network study help overcome barrier obtain ongoing DFEs reduce disparity vision care utilization .
DOC.brief_title: Overcoming Barriers Vision Care Utilization African Americans With Diabetes
DOC.detailed_description: Since inception October 2010 Collaborative Network Research Study Wills Eye Institute aim : 1. establish retrospective analysis exist ophthalmic data set assess evaluate system-level individual-level factor impact access quality vision care patient diabetes ; 2. implement telephone-based educational intervention improve DFE follow-up adherence African Americans diabetes utilize prospective , cluster-based , randomized cohort design ; 3. determine feasibility effectiveness use non-invasive , non-mydriatic fundus camera ( Nidek ) community-based pharmacy set screen detect diabetic retinopathy ocular disease among individual diabetes .
DOC.criteria: Inclusion Criteria Aim 1 : 1 . Age ≥ 18 year 2 . Type 2 diabetes mellitus 3 . Had dilate fundus exam ( DFE ) within past four year ( 20072010 ) . Exclusion Criteria Aim 1 : 1 ) Pregnant woman Inclusion Criteria Aim 2 3 : 1 . Age ≥ 18 year 2 . Type 2 diabetes mellitus 3 . Access telephone
